sen.j: 鶴屋 南北（つるや なんぼく）は、歌舞伎の役者および作者の名跡。
sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA is a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actors and authors.
Nanboku TSURUYA was a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actors and playwrights.
sen.cmt: 過去化、「作者」を変更しました。
sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA was a professional name of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actors and playwrights.

sen.j: 初代から三代目までが道化方役者、四代目以後が狂言作者。
sen.e: From the first to the third generations were Dokegata (one of the suitable parts of Kabuki, which provoke a laughter mainly) actors and after the forth generation were authors of Kyogen (farce played during a No play cycle).

From the first to the third generations were Dokegata (one of the suitable parts of Kabuki, which provoke a laughter mainly) actors and after the forth generation were playwrights of Kyogen (farce played during a No play cycle).

From the first to the third generations were Dokegata (one of the suitable parts of Kabuki, which provoke a laughter mainly) actors and after the forth generation were playwrights of Kyogen (farce played during a No play cycle).

sen.j: 鶴屋南北 (初代)
sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA (the first)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the first)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the first)
Date of birth unknown-1736
Date of birth unknown-1736
Date of birth unknown-1736

sen.j: 旅芝居の株を持つ家系に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in the family which had a license of the theatrical trunk.
He was born in the family which had a license of the theatrical troupe.
He was born in the family which had a license of the theatrical troupe.

sen.j: 元禄十年頃から享保廿年頃まで活躍。
sen.e: He was flourished from around 1697 to around 1735.
He flourished from around 1697 to around 1735.
He flourished from around 1697 to around 1735.

sen.j: 主に大芝居に進出し、道外方、頭取を勤めた。
sen.e: He mainly worked for a big theater and played Dokegata and todori (chief).
He mainly worked for Oshibai (a licensed theather in Edo period) and played Dokegata and Todori (chief).
sen.cmt: 「大芝居」を用語統一、統一のため大文字化しました。
sen.e: He mainly worked for Oshibai (a licensed theather in Edo period) and played Dokegata and Todori (chief).

sen.j: 別名：初代南北孫太郎。
sen.e: Another name: the first Nanboku Magotaro (孫太郎).
sen.cmt: 孫太郎の読み方不明です。
sen.e: Another name: the first Nanboku Magotaro (孫太郎)
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。
sen.e: Another name: the first Nanboku Magotaro (孫太郎)

sen.j: 鶴屋南北 (2代目)
sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA (the second)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the second)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the second)
Date of birth and death unknown.
Dates of birth and death unknown.
Dates of birth and death unknown.

sen.j: 初代の実子で旅芝居の株も継ぐ。
sen.e: He was a real son of the first and succeeded the license of the theatrical trunk.
He was a real son of the first and succeeded the license of the theatrical troupe.
He was a real son of the first and succeeded the license of the theatrical troupe.

sen.j: 正徳_(日本)五年頃から宝暦八年頃まで活躍。
sen.e: He was flourished from around 1715 to around 1758.
He flourished from around 1715 to around 1758.
He flourished from around 1715 to around 1758.

sen.e: Another name: the second Nanboku Magotaro.

sen.j: 元文元年頃から天明末年まで活躍。
sen.e: He was flourished from around 1736 to the end of the Tenmei era.
He flourished from around 1736 to the end of the Tenmei era.
He flourished from around 1736 to the end of the Tenmei era.

sen.j: 別名：三代目南北孫太郎。

sen.j: 鶴屋南北 (4代目)
sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA (the fourth)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the fourth)

He was the husband of a daughter of the third and lived from 1755 to 1829.
He was the husband of a daughter of the third and lived from 1755 to 1829.

sen.j: 通称：大南北。
sen.e: His common name was Daibanboku.
His commonly used name was Daibanboku.
His commonly used name was Daibanboku.

sen.j: 通常ただ「鶴屋南北」または「南北」といえば、この四代目のことをさす。
sen.e: Generally, the name of 'Nanboku TSURUYA' or 'Nanboku' refers to this fourth.
Generally, the name of 'Nanboku TSURUYA' or 'Nanboku' refers to this fourth.
Generally, the name of 'Nanboku TSURUYA' or 'Nanboku' refers to this fourth.

sen.j: 櫻田兵蔵 → 澤兵蔵 →（初代）勝俵蔵 → 四代目鶴屋南北
sen.e: Hyozo SAKURADA=>Hyozo SAWA=>(the first) Hyozo KATSU => Nanboku TSURUYA the fourth
Hyozo SAKURADA=>Hyozo SAWA=>(the first) Hyozo KATSU => Nanboku TSURUYA the fourth

sen.j: 別名：姥尉輔（合巻を執筆する際の筆名）
sen.e: Another name: Josuke UBA (a penname when he wrote gokan [bound-together volumes of illustrated books]).
Another name: Josuke UBA (a pen name when he wrote gokan [bound-together volumes of illustrated books])
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除、スペース挿入しました。

sen.e: Nanboku TSURUYA (the fifth)
Nanboku TSURUYA (the fifth)

sen.j: 四代目の外孫・門人、1796–1852。
sen.e: He was a grandchild from a daughter married into another family and a disciple of the fourth and lived from 1796 to 1852.
He was a grandchild from a daughter married into another family and a disciple of the fourth and lived from 1796 to 1852.
He was a grandchild from a daughter married into another family and a disciple of the fourth and lived from 1796 to 1852.

sen.j: 尾上菊五郎 (3代目)に付き四代目の旧作を手直しに尽力。
sen.e: He made efforts to rewrite an old work written by the forth under Kikugoro ONOE (the third).
He made efforts to rewrite old works written by the forth under Kikugoro ONOE (the third).
He made efforts to rewrite old works written by the forth under Kikugoro ONOE (the third).

sen.j: 弟子に瀬川如皐 (3代目)、河竹黙阿弥等を輩出。
sen.e: His disciples were Joko SEGAWA (the third), Mokuami KAWATAKE and so on.
His disciples were Joko SEGAWA (the third), Mokuami KAWATAKE and so on.

sen.j: 通称：孫太郎南北。
sen.e: Common name: Magotaro Nanboku.
Commonly used name: Magotaro Nanboku
sen.cmt: 「通称」を変更、ピリオド削除しました。
sen.e: Commonly used name: Magotaro Nanboku

sen.j: 峰千助 → 鶴峰丑左衛門 → 鶴屋孫太郎 → 二代目姥尉輔 → 二代目勝俵蔵 → 五代目鶴屋南北。
sen.e: 峰千助=>鶴峰丑左衛門=>Magotaro TSURUYA=>Josuke UBA the second=>Hyozo KATSU the second=>Nanboku TSURUYA the fifth.
sen.cmt: 峰千助、鶴峰丑左衛門の読み方不明です。
